title: Best Online Real Estate Schools in Michigan 2025
excerpt: Choosing one of the best online Michigan real estate school is crucial for your career, and it’s important to thoroughly research your options and understand…
content:
Choosing one of the best online Michigan real estate school is crucial for your career, and it’s important to thoroughly research your options and understand what each course offers. While there are countless real estate schools available, only a select few stand out for their exceptional education and comprehensive support in preparing you to obtain your real estate license.

At Smart Agent Alliance, we are committed to guiding new agents in launching successful careers. That’s why we’ve curated a list of the leading online real estate schools in Michigan. Our detailed analysis covers the offerings of each school, their course delivery methods, and a balanced view of the advantages and disadvantages of studying with each one.

  1. AceableAgent
  2. The CE Shop
  3. Colibri Real Estate
  4. RealEstateU

AceableAgent

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A+
Top Feature: Ability to study on the go with the mobile app

Why We Chose It:

AceableAgent has quickly become a favorite among students due to its modern approach and flexibility. It is exclusively focused on real estate education, offering courses for every step of a real estate career, from pre-licensing to continuing education and career advancement. The courses are state-approved and designed to be accessible from any device, providing students with the flexibility to study anywhere.

Overview:

AceableAgent offers three pre-licensing packages, all of which include the required coursework. The courses are fully online and accessible via desktop, laptop, tablet, or smartphone. This accessibility is one of AceableAgent’s standout features, allowing students to study on the go. Courses are developed by experienced professionals and are accredited by ARELLO. Additionally, AceableAgent is known for its interactive coursework, which helps students grasp and retain information effectively.

Why AceableAgent is Great for Pre-Licensing:

AceableAgent’s pre-licensing courses are available in multiple states, ensuring they meet state-specific requirements. The courses include engaging video lectures, interactive content, and practice exams to help students prepare effectively for their licensing exams. AceableAgent offers a satisfaction guarantee and provides career resources to help new agents start their careers successfully.

User Experiences and Feedback:

Students have reported that AceableAgent’s courses are particularly user-friendly, with a modern interface that makes navigation easy. The mobile app is highly rated for its convenience, allowing users to study during commutes or breaks. The interactive content, including quizzes and video explanations, has been praised for making complex topics easier to understand. Additionally, AceableAgent’s customer service, though sometimes slow, is generally helpful and responsive to student needs.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $169
Basic Package Features: The AceableAgent 40-Hour Course includes instructor support via email, Lite Exam Prep with 1,000 practice questions, a mini course on finding a sponsoring broker, and fully narrated courses with an audio guide for all lessons.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, the upgraded packages include The Virtual Instructor package which offers 24/7 AI-assisted learning, 3 months of PrepAgent State Exam Prep with 75 videos, 70 audio lessons, digital flashcards, and 1,660+ practice questions. It includes a real estate exam prep ebook, 1 hour of private tutoring, and live webinars with Q&A sessions held five times a week.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $59
Basic Package Features: Access to Prep Agent with Thousands of practice questions; 100% money-back guarantee; 75+ real estate exam prep videos; online interactive flashcards; 100+ page exam prep ebook; hours of audio lessons; interactive vocabulary worksheet; 100s of hours of recorded webinars; live online webinars.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, the upgraded packages offer access to PrepAgent for 1 or 3 months, compared to just 1 week with the basic plan.

Flexible Learning Options: Enjoy self-paced courses that fit your schedule.

Extended Course Access: Access course materials for up to six months from your enrollment date.

Risk-Free Enrollment: Benefit from a 30-day money-back guarantee if you’re not satisfied.

Exam Success Guarantee: Pass the licensing exam within three tries or receive a full course refund.

Comprehensive Exam Preparation: Gain access to a variety of study tools including prep videos, 75 audio lessons, digital flashcards, over 1600 practice questions, a 100-page exam prep ebook, weekly live webinars, live Q&A sessions with instructors, and the option for personalized 1-on-1 tutoring.

Dedicated Support: Instructor assistance is available seven days a week via email, and customer service can be reached by email and phone from Monday to Friday.

Convenient Final Exams: Utilize online proctoring services for the final exam across the nation, although California students do not need a proctor for their pre-licensing exam.

Mobile-Friendly Platform: Study anytime, anywhere with a course platform that is fully optimized for mobile devices.

Interactive Learning Tools: Engage with interactive content designed to enhance your learning experience and retention.

Career Resources: Access additional career support services to help you transition from student to professional agent successfully.

Pros:

  • Mobile app for studying
  • High pass rates among schools with 1,000+ students
  • Engaging and entertaining course materials
  • Exam prep through PrepAgent

Cons:

  • Course access lasts for 12 months
  • Some bugs reported in the mobile app
  • Limited technical support
  • Outsourced exam proctoring

To view their current pricing for pre-licensing click this linked button. If you are interested in any of the other courses they offer, you can find that through this link as well.

The CE Shop

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A
Top Feature: Course is easy to follow, high pass rates among students

Why We Chose It: The CE Shop offers a variety of real estate education options with an interactive and inquiry-based approach in their studying methods. While their focus is mainly on continuing education, they also provide excellent pre-licensing courses, exam prep, and post-licensing education. Their courses are accredited by ARELLO and have received numerous awards for their educational programs.

Overview: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses can be taken in 34 states, through four different course packages: Courses Only, Standard Package, Value Package, and Premium Package. Every package comes with business ebooks, career resources, downloadable resources, real estate glossary, digital flashcards, study schedules, and access to instructor-led webinars. Students have praised the course content for being easy to follow and highly informative, which has led to high pass rates.

Why The CE Shop is Great for Pre-Licensing: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses emphasize real-world applications with scenario-based learning. This approach helps students apply their knowledge to practical situations they will face in their real estate careers. Additionally, The CE Shop provides an exam prep edge program that offers additional practice tests and study aids to ensure students are well-prepared for their licensing exams.

User Experiences and Feedback: The CE Shop is well-regarded for its robust customer support and comprehensive resources. The ability to access instructor-led webinars provides an additional layer of support and interaction, which can be particularly beneficial for students who need more guidance. The frequent promotions and discounts make it a cost-effective option for many. Students appreciate the clear and structured study schedules, which help them stay on track and complete the course efficiently.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $156.75
Basic Package Features: Includes all 40 mandatory hours required for the Michigan Real Estate Salesperson license. It prepares you for the state licensing exam and equips you with essential business knowledge for a successful real estate career in Michigan.
Upgrade Packages: Includes the 40-hour MI Fundamentals of Real Estate for Salespersons Course, the eTextbook “Real Estate Basics and Beyond,” and MI Exam Prep Edge, fulfilling the requirements for a Michigan Salesperson license. It also includes your first license renewal package for free and the ProPath Real Estate Career Kickstarter, offering 9 hours of professional development with courses on business planning, lead generation, and negotiation skills.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $101.25
Basic Package Features: Fully prepares you for the Michigan Salesperson national and state licensing exams using Exam Prep Edge, an intuitive online study tool. It includes an initial assessment with instant feedback, dynamic practice exams, and real-time dashboards to track your progress and focus on areas needing improvement before exam day.
Upgrade Packages: None

Continuing Education

Price Starts at: $89
Basic Package Features: Includes 12 continuing education hours required for Michigan license renewal: 2 legal update hours, 1 fair housing hour, and 9 elective hours. Courses include “Agency in Michigan” (2 legal update hours), “Sex and Real Estate: Sexual Harassment, Sexual Discrimination, and Fair Housing” (1 fair housing hour and 2 elective hours), “Using the Code to Solve Ethical Dilemmas” (3 elective hours), and “Residential Property Management Essentials” (4 elective hours).
Upgrade Packages: Yes, includes the ProPath Real Estate Business Builder program, offering professional development courses on key business skills. Learn pricing strategies to enhance your sales goals, tax planning for self-employed individuals, and budgeting techniques to manage earnings, expenses, and savings for a successful real estate career.

Learning Format: Flexible, self-paced online courses.

Access Duration: Six months from the start date.

Money-Back Guarantee: Full refund within 30 days if less than 50% of the course is completed.

Pass Assurance: Exam cost reimbursed if you don’t pass on the first attempt.

Exam Preparation: Targeted review sessions, custom study plans, unlimited practice tests, and live webinars.

Support Services: Available daily via email, phone, or chat.

Final Exam Procedure: Online proctoring available nationwide; California exams are administered by the DRE at specific centers.

Extra Resources: Includes digital flashcards, a real estate glossary, a study schedule, business courses, and state-specific content.

Pros:

  • Multiple study package options and monthly payment plans
  • High pass rates among students
  • Interactive and easy-to-follow course material
  • Frequent discounts and promotions

Cons:

  • Mainly text-based study materials
  • Some students find the materials take longer to complete than expected
  • Limited coverage of real estate math

To view their current pricing for pre-licensing, first click this linked button, then under the main heading select “Real Estate” then fill in your State, Education, and License type (Your State, Pre-Licencing, Sales-Licencing)

Colibri Real Estate

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A
Top Feature: Affordable and comprehensive study materials

Why We Chose It: Colibri Real Estate is known for its affordability and thorough course materials. It provides excellent support to students preparing for their exams and offers a range of courses that cater to different learning needs. Colibri’s courses are designed to be clear and easy to understand, making them a great choice for budget-conscious students.

Overview: Colibri Real Estate offers various online courses with comprehensive study materials. The courses are designed to prepare students effectively for their licensing exams, with detailed support and resources. The pricing is competitive, making it an accessible option for many students.

Why Colibri Real Estate is Great for Pre-Licensing: Colibri Real Estate’ pre-licensing courses include interactive study tools such as flashcards, practice tests, and exam simulators. The courses are state-approved and designed to meet all the requirements for licensure. Colibri also offers a “pass or don’t pay” guarantee, ensuring students can retake the course if they don’t pass the exam on the first try. They also provide a career starter guide to help new agents transition smoothly into their real estate careers.

User Experiences and Feedback: Colibri Real Estate has a strong reputation for providing value for money. The comprehensive study materials are frequently updated to reflect the latest industry standards and practices. Students have noted that the detailed exam preparation support, including practice exams and study guides, is particularly helpful for passing the state licensing exams. The school’s customer support, though sometimes slow, is knowledgeable and helpful in resolving issues.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $123.60
Basic Package Features: Includes 40 state-required hours and offers the flexibility to learn through audio options. You’ll connect with expert instructors, and receive three e-books—”Fearless Math,” “Quick Start Guide,” and the course manual—to help you master essential real estate concepts and prepare for the Michigan licensing exam.
Upgrade Packages: Offers comprehensive preparation for your real estate license exam, featuring interactive tools, flashcards, unlimited practice tests, and a Readiness Tracker. It includes simulated state exams, audible course summaries, and a live Exam Crammer series with webinars and Q&A sessions. Additionally, you’ll receive a 1-year Career Booster Pack with professional growth tools, and a printed course textbook for on-the-go learning.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $69
Basic Package Features: CompuCram Exam Prep: Includes simulated exams, flashcards, a readiness assessment, and audio review guides to help you prepare effectively.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, Includes Live & Interactive Instruction which includes an exam crammer webinar series and instructor Q&A. Also includes the Post-License Course which offers a 90-hour program with state-approved instructor support.

Continuing Education

Price Starts at: $89
Basic Package Features: Includes three courses: May the Code Be With You, covering the National Association of REALTORS® Code of Ethics; Taking the Distress Out of Distressed Properties, which teaches strategies for handling foreclosures and short sales; and Serving Generational Clients, focusing on home buying and selling trends across six generations, including eco-friendly features and multi-generational homes.
Upgrade Packages: Includes a narrating audio option for coursework, allowing you to learn at your convenience. It features the Michigan License Laws and Rules course, fulfilling the two-hour continuing education requirement by covering Michigan’s license laws, common violations, and enforcement processes. Additionally, the Michigan Assistance Animals course provides 1 hour of CE, focusing on compliance with the Fair Housing Act, particularly regarding accommodating persons with disabilities and their assistance animals.

Learning Options: Choose between self-paced online courses or live-streamed classes with real-time instructors for a classroom-like experience from home.

Course Access: Six months of access from the enrollment date.

Refund Policy: Full refund for self-paced courses if canceled within 30 days, and within 24 hours for live-stream courses.

Pass Guarantee: For packages with exam prep, Colibri will refund the course cost if you score 80% or higher on simulated exams but don’t pass the state exam on the first try.

Exam Preparation: Includes digital flashcards, mock exams, readiness assessments, audio review guides, live Q&A sessions, and six one-hour live webinars with instructors for focused preparation.

Instructor Support: Available by phone during business hours or via email for additional assistance.

Final Exam Process: Virtual proctoring available nationwide; in California, the DRE administers the exam at designated centers.

Additional Resources: Access to state-specific pre-licensing, continuing education, broker licensing, and mortgage licensing courses, as well as practice exams and a real estate dictionary.

Pros:

  • Affordable courses
  • Comprehensive study materials
  • Detailed exam preparation support

Cons:

  • Limited interactivity in course materials
  • Some students found customer support to be slow

RealEstateU

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A-
Top Feature: Best affordable courses available

Why We Chose It: RealEstateU is known for its affordability and straightforward approach to real estate education. The audio-based courses are perfect for students who prefer to study on the go. The courses are designed to be simple yet effective, making them an excellent choice for budget-conscious students.

Overview: RealEstateU offers audio lectures that can be accessed on a computer, smartphone, or tablet. The courses are divided into chapters with related key terms, infographics, and quizzes to reinforce learning. Students can take the final exam online and receive a certificate of completion upon passing. The courses are highly affordable, often available at discounted rates.

Why RealEstateU is Great for Pre-Licensing: RealEstateU’s pre-licensing courses are tailored for various states, ensuring compliance with state-specific regulations. The audio-based format is ideal for students who prefer auditory learning, and the courses are designed to be flexible and convenient. RealEstateU also offers an online exam prep course to help students prepare for their licensing exam and includes a detailed course completion timeline to keep students on track.

User Experiences and Feedback: RealEstateU’s unique audio-based approach allows students to study hands-free, making it convenient for those with busy schedules. The courses are structured to be easy to follow, with clear explanations and relevant examples. Students appreciate the flexibility to listen to lectures while commuting or during other activities. The affordable pricing, coupled with frequent discounts, makes RealEstateU an attractive option for many.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $99
Basic Package Features: The 40-hour Michigan Real Estate License Course includes all state-required training hours and allows you to study at your own pace with on-demand lessons. Ideal for self-motivated learners, this course provides everything you need to prepare for the Michigan licensing exam.

Upgrade Packages: Offers a comprehensive State Exam Study Guide designed to drastically reduce your study time by up to 90% by focusing on the exact information needed for the exam. It includes sample questions, six practice exams, and quick-reference lessons linked directly to the full course. The e-Textbook covers all course content, including infographics and key terms, accessible offline and easy to print and highlight. Additionally, the Blueprint to $100k/year course provides actionable steps for newly licensed agents to start closing deals and earning income quickly.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $79
Basic Package Features: Includes a comprehensive study guide for the Michigan real estate license exam, along with three practice tests. This prep course is designed to help you focus on essential content, significantly reducing your study time by up to 90%.
Upgrade Packages: None

Learning Formats: RealEstateU offers self-paced online courses with audio lessons and downloadable materials to help you learn at your own convenience. The courses are accessible on any device, making it easy to study anytime, anywhere.

Course Access: Courses are available for 12 months from the date of enrollment, giving you ample time to complete your studies.

Refund Policy: They offer a 30-day satisfaction guarantee. If you complete less than 50% of the course and are not satisfied, you can request a refund within this period.

Exam Preparation: The courses include state exam study guides, sample questions, practice exams, and an “Agent Success Course” to help you prepare thoroughly for the licensing exam.

Student Support: 24/7 customer support is available via email to assist with any questions or issues.

Additional Resources: Infographic materials, e-textbooks, and detailed lesson outlines to enhance learning. They also offer specialized real estate investment courses covering topics like real estate accounting, syndication, and off-market transactions.

Pros:

  • Affordable prices and frequent discounts
  • Flexibility to study on the go with audio courses
  • 30-day money-back guarantee

Cons:

  • Study materials may not be as in-depth
  • No live instructor support
  • Limited additional study materials

Our Review Process:

At SmartAgentAlliance, our goal is to provide accurate and helpful reviews of online real estate schools to assist prospective real estate agents in making informed decisions. Our review process involves several key steps:

Research and Data Collection:

We begin by gathering comprehensive information about each real estate school, including course offerings, pricing, accreditation, and user reviews. This involves visiting the schools’ websites, reading third-party reviews, and gathering feedback from current and former students.

Evaluation Criteria:

Our evaluation is based on several important criteria, including:

  • Course Quality: We assess the content and structure of the courses to ensure they cover all necessary topics comprehensively and are easy to follow.
  • Accessibility: We evaluate the flexibility and accessibility of the courses, including the availability of mobile apps and study materials.
  • Pass Rates: We consider the pass rates of students who have completed the courses and taken the licensing exam.
  • Student Support: We look at the level of support provided to students, including access to instructors, customer service, and additional resources like study guides and practice exams.
  • Pricing: We compare the cost of the courses relative to the value they offer, including any discounts or payment plans available.
  • User Feedback: We gather and analyze feedback from students who have taken the courses to get an understanding of their experiences and satisfaction levels.

Scoring and Ranking:

Each school is scored based on the evaluation criteria, and an overall score is calculated. The scores are then used to rank the schools, with additional considerations given to standout features that may set a school apart from the rest.

title: Sotheby's vs Berkshire Hathaway: Which is Best for Realtors?
excerpt: This article will provide a comprehensive comparison between Sotheby's and Berkshire Hathaway to help you determine which brokerage better aligns with your professional goals. Choosing…
content:
This article will provide a comprehensive comparison between Sotheby’s and Berkshire Hathaway to help you determine which brokerage better aligns with your professional goals. Choosing the right brokerage is a critical decision for any real estate agent, as it significantly impacts their career trajectory and financial success.

Commission Splits and Fees
Income Opportunities
Training and Support
Technology and Resources
Agent Satisfaction
Final Thoughts on Sotheby’s vs Berkshire Hathaway
Join Our FREE Team at eXp Realty

Commission Splits and Fees

The commission splits and associated fees are crucial factors to consider when selecting a brokerage. Sotheby’s offers agent/broker commission splits ranging from 70/30 to 90/10, with a 6% franchise/royalty fee. This means that agents at Sotheby’s can retain between 70% to 90% of their commissions, but must pay a 6% fee on their gross commission income. Berkshire Hathaway, on the other hand, provides splits starting at 60/40 and going up to 90/10, also with a 6% franchise/royalty fee. Therefore, agents at Berkshire Hathaway can retain between 60% to 90% of their commissions, subject to the same 6% fee on their gross commission income.

Monthly fees also differ significantly between the two brokerages. Both Sotheby’s and Berkshire Hathaway have fees that vary by office location, reflecting differences in local markets and office operating costs. However, a notable difference lies in the treatment of transaction fees. Sotheby’s includes transaction fees within their royalty fees, simplifying the cost structure for agents. In contrast, Berkshire Hathaway charges between $295 and $625 per transaction, which can add up for agents with a high volume of transactions. These differences can impact an agent’s net income and financial planning, making it important to consider each brokerage’s fee structure carefully.

Income Opportunities

The potential for additional income streams can significantly enhance an agent’s financial stability and growth. Unfortunately, neither Sotheby’s nor Berkshire Hathaway offers revenue share programs, retirement income paths, or willable income paths. This limitation means that agents are primarily reliant on their commission-based earnings. In contrast to some other brokerages that offer multiple streams of income, such as revenue sharing or passive income opportunities, Sotheby’s and Berkshire Hathaway focus solely on commission income.

Training and Support

Effective training and support are vital for both new and experienced agents. Both Sotheby’s and Berkshire Hathaway provide training programs, but the quality and availability of these programs can vary by office. Sotheby’s offers training that is tailored to the needs of luxury real estate markets, reflecting its brand positioning. This can be particularly valuable for agents who specialize in high-end properties. Berkshire Hathaway also provides training, but it varies by office, which might lead to inconsistencies in the quality of training received. The lack of standardized training across offices can be a drawback for agents who prefer a more consistent training experience.

Neither brokerage offers 24/7 support, which can be crucial for agents who require ongoing assistance and professional development. The absence of round-the-clock support means that agents might need to rely on local office resources or peer networks for assistance outside of regular business hours. This can be a limitation for agents who need immediate support or who work in markets with extended hours.

Technology and Resources

In the modern real estate landscape, leveraging technology effectively is essential. Both Sotheby’s and Berkshire Hathaway incorporate technological tools to enhance agent productivity and client engagement. Sotheby’s offers a range of technology solutions tailored to the luxury market, including advanced marketing tools and CRM systems designed to meet the needs of high-net-worth clients. Berkshire Hathaway also invests in technology, providing agents with tools to streamline transactions, manage leads, and market properties effectively. However, the specific technology offerings can vary by office, reflecting differences in local market needs and office resources. Both brokerages provide valuable technological resources, but the specific tools and platforms offered may appeal differently depending on the agent’s needs.

Agent Satisfaction

Agent satisfaction is a key indicator of a brokerage’s effectiveness and overall agent happiness. Sotheby’s has a Glassdoor rating of 4.0 stars based on 501 reviews, indicating strong agent approval and satisfaction. The positive rating reflects Sotheby’s strong brand, support for luxury market specialists, and the resources available to agents. Berkshire Hathaway holds a slightly higher rating of 4.2 stars from 981 reviews, suggesting relatively higher agent satisfaction. The higher rating for Berkshire Hathaway may reflect its broader market reach, diverse training opportunities, and support resources. The differences in agent satisfaction can often be attributed to the varying levels of support, training, and income opportunities provided by each brokerage.

Final Thoughts on Sotheby’s vs Berkshire Hathaway

In comparing Sotheby’s and Berkshire Hathaway, it’s evident that each brokerage has its strengths and weaknesses. Sotheby’s offers a prestigious brand, strong support for luxury market specialists, and a simplified cost structure with inclusive transaction fees. However, its focus on the luxury market may not appeal to all agents, and the variability in training quality can be a drawback.

Berkshire Hathaway offers a broader market reach, consistent support, and a higher overall agent satisfaction rating. However, the additional transaction fees can impact net income, and the variability in training quality across offices can be a concern. Both brokerages lack supplementary income opportunities such as revenue sharing, which might limit long-term financial growth for agents.

For a more detailed comparison and to find the best brokerage for your needs, check out our brokerage comparison tool. When making your decision, consider your specific needs and career objectives. Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages carefully to choose the brokerage that best fits your professional aspirations. Whether you prioritize comprehensive support and training or seek a brokerage with a more conventional setup, your decision should align with your long-term career goals and preferences.

When you join us at Smart Agent Alliance, you’ll also be part of the Wolf Pack at eXp Realty.  Together we are one big team and we provide more FREE value than you’ll get anywhere else in the real estate business.

What’s included? title: How to Get a Real Estate License in Illinois: 2025 Guide
excerpt: Embarking on the journey to obtain your Illinois real estate license might seem overwhelming, but with the proper guidance, it becomes a manageable process. This…
content:
Embarking on the journey to obtain your Illinois real estate license might seem overwhelming, but with the proper guidance, it becomes a manageable process. This detailed guide will walk you through every step, ensuring you’re thoroughly prepared to launch your real estate career in Illinois. Let’s get started on your path to becoming a licensed real estate professional.

  1. Basic Requirements
  2. Choosing a Real Estate School
  3. Find a Sponsoring Broker
  4. Why Join Smart Agent Alliance?

Basic Requirements

Before you start the process, it’s essential to understand the basic requirements for obtaining a real estate license in Illinois. Here’s what you need to know:

To apply for a real estate license in Illinois, you must be at least 21 years old. However, individuals who are 18 years old can apply if they have the sponsorship of a managing broker. This ensures applicants have the maturity and legal responsibility necessary for the profession.

You do not need to be an Illinois resident to obtain a license, but you must have a valid Social Security Number (SSN) or an Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (ITIN). This identification is crucial for the required background checks and compliance with state regulations?.

Integrity is key in the real estate profession. Illinois requires all applicants to undergo a fingerprint-based criminal background check to ensure public safety. Any past legal issues could affect your application, so transparency is critical.

In Illinois, aspiring real estate brokers must complete 75 hours of pre-licensing education. This education is divided into two main courses that cover critical topics such as real estate principles, contracts, and Illinois-specific laws.

This course provides a comprehensive foundation in real estate, covering essential concepts such as property ownership, land use controls, state regulations, and real estate transactions. Mastering these principles is crucial for anyone aiming to succeed in the Illinois real estate industry?.

This course is interactive, often involving role-playing and case studies, to help students apply what they’ve learned in real-world scenarios. It focuses on practical skills needed to navigate real estate transactions effectively

Choosing a Real Estate School

Selecting the right real estate school is crucial. Look for accredited schools that offer flexibility, especially if you have a busy schedule. Online courses can provide the convenience of studying at your own pace.

Research Schools

Start by researching various real estate schools and reading reviews from past students. Look for schools with high pass rates for the real estate exam and positive feedback on their teaching methods.

Online vs In-Person Classes

Decide whether you prefer online or in-person classes. Online courses offer flexibility and convenience, allowing you to study at your own pace. In-person classes provide direct interaction with instructors and peers, which can enhance your learning experience.

Evaluate Course Materials

Evaluate the course materials and support services provided by the school. High-quality textbooks, interactive lessons, and access to instructors for questions can significantly impact your success. Some schools also offer additional resources like exam prep courses and study groups.

Study Tips

Create a daily study schedule that covers all exam topics, ensuring regular review sessions. (Asana provides a great FREE task manager)

Utilize flashcards for key terms and concepts to enhance memorization. (These Quizlet Flashcards may be helpful)

Regularly take practice tests to gauge your understanding and get familiar with the exam format. (Free Illinois Real Estate Practice Exam)

After completing your pre-licensing education, the next step is to submit your license application to the Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR).

Complete the Application Form: Fill out the online application through the IDFPR website. Create an account and access the application portal directly.

Gather Required Documents: Ensure you have proof of completed pre-licensing education, identification documents, and your fingerprinting results ready for submission.

Schedule Fingerprinting: Schedule an appointment with an approved fingerprinting service provider. Illinois requires that your fingerprints be submitted as part of the background check process?.

Submit Your Application: Submit your application online through the IDFPR’s online services portal. Double-check that all information is accurate and complete before submission to avoid any delay.

IDFPR typically takes several weeks to process your application. They will review your education transcripts and verify that all requirements are met. Make sure your application is complete to avoid any delays

You can track the status of your application online through IDFPR’s website. Regularly checking the status can help you stay informed of any issues or additional requirements. If there are delays, contacting IDFPR directly can provide clarification and help expedite the process?.

The exam is a 3.5-hour test with 100 multiple-choice questions. You need to score at least 75% to pass. Each attempt requires a new application and a fee of $37.

According to PrepAgent

  • Property Ownership
    • Types of ownership, estates in land
    • Condominiums, cooperatives, and time-sharing
  • Land Use Controls and Regulations
    • Public controls (zoning, codes)
    • Private controls (deed restrictions)
    • Environmental issues
  • Property Condition and Disclosures
    • Property conditions and inspections
    • Disclosures related to property condition
  • Transfer of Title
    • Title insurance, deeds, and title transfer
    • Recording and settlement procedures
  • Real Estate Transactions and Practices
    • Real estate contracts and agency
    • Real estate practice
    • Financing and settlement
  • Leasing and Property Management
    • Types of leases and leasing responsibilities
    • Property management and maintenance
  • Practice of Real Estate
    • Trust accounts, advertising, fair housing laws
    • Ethical and professional conduct
  • Valuation and Market Analysis
    • Appraisal process and approaches to value
    • Real estate market cycles and analysis
  • Real Estate Calculations
    • Basic math calculations (area, volume)
    • Closing costs, prorations

Exam Preparation Tips

Go over the textbooks and notes from your pre-license courses. Revisiting these materials can reinforce your understanding of key concepts. Focus on areas where you feel less confident to ensure a well-rounded preparation.

Take as many practice exams as possible. This helps you get familiar with the exam format and identify areas where you need more study. Practice exams can also help you manage your time effectively during the actual test. (Free Illinois Real Estate Practice Exam)

Join or form study groups. Discussing topics with peers can enhance understanding and retention. Study groups provide a platform to share knowledge, ask questions, and support each other.

Consider enrolling in an exam prep course for additional support and structured study. These courses often include practice exams, study guides, and expert instruction. Investing in a prep course can increase your chances of passing the exam on the first attempt.

Exam Day Tips

Ensure you arrive at the exam center early to avoid any last-minute stress. Arriving early gives you time to settle in and focus before the exam begins. Check the location and travel time in advance to plan your journey.

You’ll need a valid photo ID to enter the exam. Make sure your ID is current and matches the name on your application. Having all necessary documents ready can prevent any issues at the exam center.

Read each question carefully and manage your time wisely. Staying calm and composed can help you think clearly and avoid mistakes. Take deep breaths and stay positive throughout the exam.

Follow all instructions given by the exam proctors. Adhering to the rules ensures a smooth and fair testing experience for everyone. If you have any questions or issues, ask the proctors for assistance.

After passing the Illinois real estate exam, the next step is to complete the fingerprinting requirement for a background check. This step is essential to ensure that you meet the integrity and character standards required by the Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR).

Schedule an appointment with a fingerprinting service provider that is approved by the Illinois State Police. The electronic fingerprinting process, known as Live Scan, is efficient and secure. You can locate a nearby service provider through the IDFPR’s recommended vendors.

During your appointment, your fingerprints will be captured electronically and submitted to both the Illinois State Police and the FBI for a thorough background check. Keep a copy of any receipts or confirmation forms for your records?.

The cost for fingerprinting typically ranges from $50 to $75, depending on the provider. This fee covers the fingerprinting service and the background check. Ensure you verify the total cost when scheduling your appointment.

The DBPR will conduct a background check using your fingerprints. This check ensures you meet the honesty and integrity standards required for a real estate license. Any issues identified during the background check may need to be addressed before your license is granted.

If any issues arise during the background check, be prepared to provide additional documentation or explanations. Demonstrating honesty and taking responsibility for past actions can positively impact the DBPR’s decision. Seek legal advice if necessary to navigate any complex issues.

After passing the exam and completing the fingerprinting requirement, the next step is to submit your Broker License Application to the Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR). This application confirms that you have met all the necessary requirements.

Fill out the Broker License Application form available through the IDFPR online services portal. Ensure that all sections are completed accurately. You can access the form on the IDFPR website.

Include proof that you have successfully passed the Illinois real estate exam. This documentation is essential for IDFPR to verify your eligibility. Keep a copy of your exam results for your records?.

Attach the receipt or confirmation form from your Live Scan service provider. This document confirms that you have completed the fingerprinting requirement. Ensure all necessary signatures and details are included.

As of 2024, the fee is $125. This fee must be submitted along with your application. Be sure to keep a copy of your payment receipt for future reference.

After submitting your application, you can track its status online through the DRE’s website. Regularly checking the status can help you stay informed about any updates or additional requirements. If there are delays, contacting the DRE directly can provide clarity and expedite the process.

Find a Sponsoring Broker

Once you pass the exam, you need to find a sponsoring broker to activate your license. Look for a brokerage that aligns with your goals and offers the support you need.

What to Look For in a Broker

Find a supportive and collaborative environment. The right culture can significantly impact your job satisfaction and success.

Understand the financial arrangements. Different brokerages offer different commission splits, so choose one that suits your financial goals.

Choose a broker who provides ample training and mentorship opportunities. Early career support is crucial for your development and success.

17 Brokerage Interview Questions

  • What training programs do you offer for new agents?
  • How does your commission split work, and are there any additional fees?
  • What kind of support and resources will I have access to?
  • Can you provide references from other agents in your brokerage?

Top Brokerages to Consider

Choosing the right broker is crucial as it impacts your early career significantly. Consider top-rated brokers like eXp Realty, Keller Williams, Coldwell Banker, and Compass.

Why Join Smart Agent Alliance?

When you join Smart Agent Alliance, you get double the value because you’re also automatically a Wolf Pack member.  Together, Smart Agent Alliance and the Wolf Pack provide the tools, support, and expertise to elevate your business to new heights.

Smart Agent Alliance Benefits

At Smart Agent Alliance, we prioritize organization, clarity, and efficiency to help our agents succeed. We provide essential onboarding resources, customizable presentations, business automations, client checklists, business assets, social media content, YouTube support, a growth plan, quality lead generation, production know-how, website support, and top-notch organizational tools.

Wolf Pack Benefits

The Wolf Pack team at eXp Realty offers expert-led courses like Social Agent Academy 3.0, the Wolf Pack Hub, and the Investor Army for property flipping. We provide tailored assistance for new agents, developing agents, top producers, team leaders, and broker owners. Key resources include lead generation, production know-how, social media content, and YouTube support.

Why eXp Realty?

eXp Realty offers a comprehensive range of benefits for agents, focusing on top pay structures, low fees, and free stock options. Agents get an 80/20 commission splits that cap at $16,000 annually, with opportunities to earn 100% commission, receive annual stock awards and gain income through Revenue Share. Additional resources include 24/7 agent support, affordable healthcare, live training, and advanced tech tools like kvCORE and customizable IDX websites.

Starting a career in real estate involves some initial costs and financial planning. Understanding these costs and planning accordingly will help you manage your finances effectively.

Initial Expenses Breakdown

All stated fees are subject to change.

  • Initial Expenses: These include licensing fees, marketing expenses, office supplies, and technology tools needed to start your career. For example, initial expenses may include:
    • Pre-Licensing Course: $100-$500+
    • Exam Fee: $58 per attempt
    • Application Fee: $125
    • Fingerprinting Fee: Roughly $50-$75
    • Marketing Materials: Business cards, signage, and online advertising costs
  • When you join a brokerage in Illinois, many will require you to become a member of the National, State, and Local Associations of Realtors. Additionally, you’ll need to pay fees for the Multiple Listing Service (MLS) and Supra Key services.
    • National Association of Realtors (NAR):
      • Membership Fees: For 2024, the NAR annual dues are $156, plus a $45 special assessment fee for the Consumer Advertising Campaign, bringing the total to $201 per year.
    • Illinois Realtors (State Association):
      • Membership Fees: The annual dues for Illinois Realtors in 2024 are approximately $180. This is in addition to the NAR dues.
    • Local Association of Realtors:
      • Membership Fees: Local association fees in Illinois vary depending on the specific association. For example:
      • Chicago Association of Realtors (CAR): The annual dues are typically around $300 to $400.
      • Mainstreet Organization of Realtors (MORe): The dues are generally in the range of $250 to $350 per year.
    • Multiple Listing Service (MLS):
      • Fees: MLS fees in Illinois also vary by region. For instance:
        • Midwest Real Estate Data (MRED) MLS, which serves a large portion of Illinois including Chicago, charges about $504 annually.
        • Other local MLS services in Illinois might have slightly different fee structures.
    • Supra Key Fees:
      • Fees: Supra Key services in Illinois usually include an initial setup fee, around $50, and a monthly service fee ranging from $20 to $25.

These fees are approximate and can vary slightly depending on your exact location and the specific associations or MLS you join. It’s always advisable to verify the latest fees with the local associations or MLS for the most accurate and up-to-date information.

  • Create a Budget: Track your expenses and forecast your income. Plan for slower months to ensure financial stability.
  • Emergency Fund: Set aside an emergency fund to cover unexpected expenses or slow periods in the market
  • Commission Structure: Real estate agents typically earn commissions from sales. Understand how your brokerage’s commission structure works and how to manage irregular income streams. Commission splits can vary widely, typically ranging from 50/50 to 70/30 or higher, depending on the brokerage.
  • Tax Planning: As an independent contractor, it’s important to plan for taxes. Keep track of deductible expenses, make estimated tax payments, and maintain good record-keeping practices. Consulting with a tax professional can help ensure compliance and optimize your tax strategy.

To get an Illinois real estate license, you must be at least 18 years old, complete 75 hours of pre-license coursework, pass the state licensing exam, and undergo a fingerprint-based background check .

The cost to get a real estate license in Illinois typically ranges from $350 to $760+. This includes the pre-licensing course ($100-$500+), application fee ($125), background check fee ($50-$75), and exam fee ($58).

It typically takes 3 to 4 months to get a real estate license in Illinois, depending on how quickly you complete the 75 hours of pre-licensing coursework and pass the state exam. Some students may complete the process faster, while others may take longer based on their schedule and availability of exam dates .

The pass rate for the Illinois real estate exam is relatively low, with some reports indicating a pass rate of about 33.3%. To pass, candidates must score at least 75% on both the national and Illinois-specific portions of the exam.

What happens if I fail the real estate exam?

If you fail the Illinois real estate exam, you can retake the exam up to three more times, giving you a total of four attempts. If you fail only one portion of the exam (either the general or the Illinois-specific section), you only need to retake the failed portion. If you fail all four attempts, you will need to retake the pre-license coursework before attempting the exam again.

How do I renew my real estate license?

To renew your Illinois real estate license, follow these steps:

1. Complete Continuing Education: Ensure you have completed the required continuing education (CE) hours before the renewal deadline.

2. Submit Your Renewal Application: Go to the Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR) online license renewal portal to submit your renewal application. You’ll need to confirm your completed CE and update any necessary personal information.

3. Pay the Renewal Fee: Submit the $200 renewal fee online through the IDFPR portal.

You can begin the renewal process 2-3 months before your license expiration date .

content:
Choosing one of the best online Illinois real estate school is crucial for your career, and it’s important to thoroughly research your options and understand what each course offers. While there are countless real estate schools available, only a select few stand out for their exceptional education and comprehensive support in preparing you to obtain your real estate license.

At Smart Agent Alliance, we are committed to guiding new agents in launching successful careers. That’s why we’ve curated a list of the leading online real estate schools in Illinois. Our detailed analysis covers the offerings of each school, their course delivery methods, and a balanced view of the advantages and disadvantages of studying with each one.

  1. The CE Shop
  2. Colibri Real Estate
  3. Illinois REALTORS

The CE Shop

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A
Top Feature: Course is easy to follow, high pass rates among students

Why We Chose It: The CE Shop offers a variety of real estate education options with an interactive and inquiry-based approach in their studying methods. While their focus is mainly on continuing education, they also provide excellent pre-licensing courses, exam prep, and post-licensing education. Their courses are accredited by ARELLO and have received numerous awards for their educational programs.

Overview: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses can be taken in 34 states, through four different course packages: Courses Only, Standard Package, Value Package, and Premium Package. Every package comes with business ebooks, career resources, downloadable resources, real estate glossary, digital flashcards, study schedules, and access to instructor-led webinars. Students have praised the course content for being easy to follow and highly informative, which has led to high pass rates.

Why The CE Shop is Great for Pre-Licensing: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses emphasize real-world applications with scenario-based learning. This approach helps students apply their knowledge to practical situations they will face in their real estate careers. Additionally, The CE Shop provides an exam prep edge program that offers additional practice tests and study aids to ensure students are well-prepared for their licensing exams.

User Experiences and Feedback: The CE Shop is well-regarded for its robust customer support and comprehensive resources. The ability to access instructor-led webinars provides an additional layer of support and interaction, which can be particularly beneficial for students who need more guidance. The frequent promotions and discounts make it a cost-effective option for many. Students appreciate the clear and structured study schedules, which help them stay on track and complete the course efficiently.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $233.35
Basic Package Features: Illinois Broker License Package: This package includes 75 hours of instruction required for the Illinois broker license, covering exam preparation and essential business knowledge. The courses include a 60-hour Broker Pre-License Topics and a 15-hour Applied Real Estate Principles – Interactive.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, they have packages all the way up to their Premium package. This 75-hour package fulfills the Illinois broker license requirements and includes exam prep, business-building courses, an eTextbook, and a 45-hour Post-Licensing course for your first renewal. It also features the ProPath Real Estate Career Kickstarter, offering 9 hours of professional development on business planning, lead generation, and negotiation skills.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $101.25
Basic Package Features:This program covers the entire Illinois Broker licensing exam and includes Exam Prep Edge, an intuitive online study tool. It features an initial assessment with immediate feedback, dynamic practice exams with unique questions, and real-time dashboards to track your progress and focus on areas needing improvement before exam day.
Upgrade Packages: None

Post-Licensing

Price Starts at: $295
Basic Package Features: Illinois Broker Post-Licensing Package: This complete 45-hour package covers all required courses for first-time license renewal, including 15-hour Applied Brokerage Principles, 15-hour Risk Management and Discipline (including 1-hour Sexual Harassment Prevention Training), and 15-hour Transactional Issues.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, The ProPath including courses on Applied Brokerage Principles, Risk Management and Discipline, and Transactional Issues, with required Sexual Harassment Prevention Training. It also includes the ProPath Real Estate Business Builder program, covering pricing strategies, tax planning for the self-employed, and business budgeting.

Continuing Education

Price Starts at: $115
Basic Package Features:Illinois Broker CE Package: This 12-hour continuing education package for active brokers includes 4 mandatory core hours and 8 elective hours. It covers Ethical Excellence (4 elective hours) and includes the required 1-hour Sexual Harassment Prevention Training as part of the elective hours.
Upgrade Packages: ProPath Network Builder Program: This program enhances your real estate career by teaching you to build a strong referral network, master personal branding, and develop strategic communication tools. You’ll also learn to boost visibility in a competitive market through social media and web optimization, and cultivate long-term business relationships by enhancing client satisfaction and trust.

Access Duration: Six months from the start date.

Money-Back Guarantee: Full refund within 30 days if less than 50% of the course is completed.

Pass Assurance: Exam cost reimbursed if you don’t pass on the first attempt.

Exam Preparation: Targeted review sessions, custom study plans, unlimited practice tests, and live webinars.

Support Services: Available daily via email, phone, or chat.

Final Exam Procedure: Online proctoring available nationwide; California exams are administered by the DRE at specific centers.

Pros:

  • High pass rates among students
  • Interactive and easy-to-follow course material
  • Frequent discounts and promotions

Cons:

  • Some students find the materials take longer to complete than expected
  • Limited coverage of real estate math

Colibri’s courses are designed to be clear and easy to understand, making them a great choice for budget-conscious students.

Overview: Colibri Real Estate offers various online courses with comprehensive study materials. The courses are designed to prepare students effectively for their licensing exams, with detailed support and resources. The pricing is competitive, making it an accessible option for many students.

Why Colibri Real Estate is Great for Pre-Licensing: Colibri Real Estate’ pre-licensing courses include interactive study tools such as flashcards, practice tests, and exam simulators. The courses are state-approved and designed to meet all the requirements for licensure. Colibri also offers a “pass or don’t pay” guarantee, ensuring students can retake the course if they don’t pass the exam on the first try. They also provide a career starter guide to help new agents transition smoothly into their real estate careers.

User Experiences and Feedback: Colibri Real Estate has a strong reputation for providing value for money. The comprehensive study materials are frequently updated to reflect the latest industry standards and practices. Students have noted that the detailed exam preparation support, including practice exams and study guides, is particularly helpful for passing the state licensing exams. The school’s customer support, though sometimes slow, is knowledgeable and helpful in resolving issues.

It also offers live and interactive instruction through the Exam Crammer Webinar Series and Instructor Q&A. Additionally, a 45-hour post-license course with state-approved instructor support is included.

Basic Package Features: Offers self-paced online courses, allowing you to complete the state-required hours on your own time with support from expert local instructors. It includes a RISMedia Premier Membership, providing access to premium journalism, market analysis, webinars, and exclusive events. Additionally, the package features a narrated audio option, enabling you to learn when and where you want while staying compliant in Illinois.
Upgrade Packages: None

Continuing Education

Price Starts at: $109
Basic Package Features:This 12-hour course package includes narrated audio options for flexible learning, covering essential topics for Illinois real estate compliance. Courses include the Illinois 4-Hour Core, focusing on consumer protection and compliance with the Real Estate License Act of 2000; “May the Code Be With You,” which addresses the National Association of REALTORS® Code of Ethics; Sexual Harassment Prevention Training, emphasizing risk management; and a Fair Housing course that covers key laws and non-discriminatory practices.

Final Exam Process: Virtual proctoring is available nationwide; Illinois state exams are administered by the IDFPR at designated testing centers.

Our Review Process:

At SmartAgentAlliance, our goal is to provide accurate and helpful reviews of online real estate schools to assist prospective real estate agents in making informed decisions. Our review process involves several key steps:

Research and Data Collection:

We begin by gathering comprehensive information about each real estate school, including course offerings, pricing, accreditation, and user reviews. This involves visiting the schools’ websites, reading third-party reviews, and gathering feedback from current and former students.

Evaluation Criteria:

Our evaluation is based on several important criteria, including:

  • Course Quality: We assess the content and structure of the courses to ensure they cover all necessary topics comprehensively and are easy to follow.
  • Accessibility: We evaluate the flexibility and accessibility of the courses, including the availability of mobile apps and study materials.
  • Pass Rates: We consider the pass rates of students who have completed the courses and taken the licensing exam.
  • Student Support: We look at the level of support provided to students, including access to instructors, customer service, and additional resources like study guides and practice exams.
  • Pricing: We compare the cost of the courses relative to the value they offer, including any discounts or payment plans available.
  • User Feedback: We gather and analyze feedback from students who have taken the courses to get an understanding of their experiences and satisfaction levels.

Scoring and Ranking:

Each school is scored based on the evaluation criteria, and an overall score is calculated. The scores are then used to rank the schools, with additional considerations given to standout features that may set a school apart from the rest.

The CE Shop, Colibri Real Estate Schools, and 360 Training.

The Illinois real estate pre-license courses cover essential topics to prepare you for the state licensing exam and a successful career in real estate. Key areas include:

  1. Real Estate Principles: Basic concepts, property rights, and ownership types.
  2. Illinois Real Estate Law: Contracts, agency relationships, and fair housing.
  3. Finance: Mortgages, financing, and lender roles.
  4. Property Valuation: Market analysis and appraisal techniques.
  5. Real Estate Practice: Listing, marketing, negotiations, and closings.
  6. Ethics: Professional standards and conduct.
  7. Agency & Brokerage: Broker-agent relationships and fiduciary duties.
  8. Math Skills: Calculating commissions, property taxes, and mortgages.
  9. Exam Prep: Practice questions and test strategies.

Completing these courses equips you with the knowledge to pass the Illinois licensing exam and succeed in the real estate market.

When choosing the best online Illinois real estate school, consider:

  1. Accreditation: Ensure IDFPR approval.
  2. Content: Comprehensive, Illinois-specific curriculum.
  3. Flexibility: Self-paced or live options.
  4. Support: Access to instructors and study aids.
  5. Reputation: Positive reviews and high pass rates.
  6. Cost: Affordable without sacrificing quality.

Evaluate these factors to find the right school for your needs.

title: Keller Williams vs Redfin: Which is Best for Realtors in 2025?
excerpt: This article will provide a comprehensive comparison between Keller Williams vs Redfin to help you determine which brokerage better aligns with your professional goals. Choosing…
content:
This article will provide a comprehensive comparison between Keller Williams vs Redfin to help you determine which brokerage better aligns with your professional goals. Choosing the right brokerage is a critical decision for any real estate agent, as it significantly impacts their career trajectory and financial success.

Commission Splits and Fees
Income Opportunities
Training and Support
Technology and Resources
Agent Satisfaction
Final Thoughts on Keller Williams vs Redfin
Join Our FREE Team at eXp Realty

Commission Splits and Fees

The commission splits and associated fees are crucial factors to consider when selecting a brokerage. Keller Williams offers flexible splits ranging from 70/30 to 100/0, with a 6% franchise/royalty fee until the cap is reached. In contrast, Redfin provides splits starting at 30/70 (with a base salary) and going up to 75/25, with no franchise/royalty fee.

Monthly fees also differ significantly. Keller Williams’ fees vary by office, whereas Redfin has no monthly fees. Additionally, Keller Williams does not charge transaction fees, while Redfin also does not charge transaction fees. These differences can impact an agent’s net income and financial planning, making it important to consider each brokerage’s fee structure.

Income Opportunities

The potential for additional income streams can significantly enhance an agent’s financial stability and growth. Keller Williams stands out by offering revenue share programs that provide a retirement and willable income path. These additional income streams can offer substantial long-term financial benefits and security. Conversely, Redfin does not offer such supplementary income opportunities, limiting agents primarily to their commission-based earnings.

Training and Support

Effective training and support are vital for both new and experienced agents. Keller Williams provides extensive training opportunities, though specific details on the extent of their offerings are not standardized across all offices. In contrast, Redfin offers four weeks of local training, which might be beneficial for hands-on learning. Neither brokerage offers 24/7 support, which can be crucial for agents who require ongoing assistance and professional development.

Technology and Resources

In the modern real estate landscape, leveraging technology effectively is essential. Keller Williams is known for its robust technology platforms, offering tools that enhance productivity and client engagement. On the other hand, Redfin is also known for its technology-driven approach, providing agents with comprehensive tools and resources. Both brokerages provide valuable technological resources, but the specific tools and platforms offered may appeal differently depending on the agent’s needs.

Agent Satisfaction

Agent satisfaction is a key indicator of a brokerage’s effectiveness and overall agent happiness. Keller Williams boasts a high Glassdoor rating of 4.3 stars based on 7.9K reviews, indicating strong agent approval and satisfaction. Redfin holds a lower rating of 3.6 stars from 1.9K reviews, suggesting that there may be areas needing improvement. The differences in agent satisfaction can often be attributed to the varying levels of support, training, and income opportunities provided by each brokerage.

Final Thoughts on Keller Williams vs Redfin

In comparing Keller Williams and Redfin, it’s evident that each brokerage has its strengths and weaknesses. Keller Williams offers more favorable commission splits, extensive training, and additional income opportunities, making it a compelling choice for both new and experienced agents. The innovative technology and comprehensive support further enhance Keller Williams’ appeal. Redfin, with its no-fee structure, agent salary option, and comprehensive local training, may attract agents looking for a cost-effective and hands-on learning environment.

For a more detailed comparison and to find the best brokerage for your needs, check out our brokerage comparison tool.

When making your decision, consider your specific needs and career objectives. Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages carefully to choose the brokerage that best fits your professional aspirations. Whether you prioritize comprehensive support and training or seek a brokerage with a more conventional setup, your decision should align with your long-term career goals and preferences.

Access our exclusive SAA Vault Assets to enhance your business efficiency, attend weekly team video calls filled with invaluable insights and top agent strategies, and receive the Social Agent Academy Program and Investor Army Courses – a combined value of over $1,500 – absolutely free. And that’s just the beginning! Explore more about our robust team benefits.

title: Best Online Texas Real Estate Schools
excerpt: Choosing one of the best online Texas real estate school is crucial for your career, and it’s important to thoroughly research your options and understand…
content:
Choosing one of the best online Texas real estate school is crucial for your career, and it’s important to thoroughly research your options and understand what each course offers. While there are countless real estate schools available, only a select few stand out for their exceptional education and comprehensive support in preparing you to obtain your real estate license.

At Smart Agent Alliance, we are committed to guiding new agents in launching successful careers. That’s why we’ve curated a list of the leading online real estate schools in Texas. Our detailed analysis covers the offerings of each school, their course delivery methods, and a balanced view of the advantages and disadvantages of studying with each one.

  1. AceableAgent
  2. The CE Shop
  3. Colibri Real Estate
  4. RealEstateU
  5. 360 Training

AceableAgent

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A+
Top Feature: Ability to study on the go with the mobile app

Why We Chose It:

AceableAgent has quickly become a favorite among students due to its modern approach and flexibility. It is exclusively focused on real estate education, offering courses for every step of a real estate career, from pre-licensing to continuing education and career advancement. The courses are state-approved and designed to be accessible from any device, providing students with the flexibility to study anywhere.

Overview:

AceableAgent offers three pre-licensing packages, all of which include the required coursework. The courses are fully online and accessible via desktop, laptop, tablet, or smartphone. This accessibility is one of AceableAgent’s standout features, allowing students to study on the go. Courses are developed by experienced professionals and are accredited by ARELLO. Additionally, AceableAgent is known for its interactive coursework, which helps students grasp and retain information effectively.

Why AceableAgent is Great for Pre-Licensing:

AceableAgent’s pre-licensing courses are available in multiple states, ensuring they meet state-specific requirements. The courses include engaging video lectures, interactive content, and practice exams to help students prepare effectively for their licensing exams. AceableAgent offers a satisfaction guarantee and provides career resources to help new agents start their careers successfully.

User Experiences and Feedback:

Students have reported that AceableAgent’s courses are particularly user-friendly, with a modern interface that makes navigation easy. The mobile app is highly rated for its convenience, allowing users to study during commutes or breaks. The interactive content, including quizzes and video explanations, has been praised for making complex topics easier to understand. Additionally, AceableAgent’s customer service, though sometimes slow, is generally helpful and responsive to student needs.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $449
Basic Package Features: 180-Hour Package: Six 30-hour online courses, email instructor support, narrated lessons, 1,000 exam practice questions, and a mini-course on finding a sponsoring broker.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, the upgraded packages offer Virtual Instructor: AI-powered, available 24/7 to answer questions and explain concepts. Includes 3 months of PrepAgent exam prep with 75 videos, 70 audio lessons, and 1,660+ practice questions. Offers live tutoring, webinars 5 times a week, and live Q&A sessions.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $59
Basic Package Features: Access to Prep Agent with Thousands of practice questions; 100% money-back guarantee; 75+ real estate exam prep videos; online interactive flashcards; 100+ page exam prep ebook; hours of audio lessons; interactive vocabulary worksheet; 100s of hours of recorded webinars; live online webinars.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, the upgraded packages offer access to PrepAgent for 1 or 3 months, compared to just 1 week with the basic plan.

Continuing Education

Price Starts at: $89
Basic Package Features: There are a bunch of separate ones but the main 18-hour package includes TREC-Approved 18-Hour Course Package: Five courses, all in one place, covering 2024-2025 requirements. Start immediately with no classroom needed. Engaging, up-to-date content available anytime.
Upgrade Packages: None

Flexible Learning Options: Enjoy self-paced courses that fit your schedule.

Extended Course Access: Access course materials for up to six months from your enrollment date.

Risk-Free Enrollment: Benefit from a 30-day money-back guarantee if you’re not satisfied.

Exam Success Guarantee: Pass the licensing exam within three tries or receive a full course refund.

Comprehensive Exam Preparation: Gain access to a variety of study tools including prep videos, 75 audio lessons, digital flashcards, over 1600 practice questions, a 100-page exam prep ebook, weekly live webinars, live Q&A sessions with instructors, and the option for personalized 1-on-1 tutoring.

Dedicated Support: Instructor assistance is available seven days a week via email, and customer service can be reached by email and phone from Monday to Friday.

Convenient Final Exams: Utilize online proctoring services for the final exam across the nation, although California students do not need a proctor for their pre-licensing exam.

Mobile-Friendly Platform: Study anytime, anywhere with a course platform that is fully optimized for mobile devices.

Interactive Learning Tools: Engage with interactive content designed to enhance your learning experience and retention.

Career Resources: Access additional career support services to help you transition from student to professional agent successfully.

Pros:

  • Mobile app for studying
  • High pass rates among schools with 1,000+ students
  • Engaging and entertaining course materials
  • Exam prep through PrepAgent

Cons:

  • Course access lasts for 12 months
  • Some bugs reported in the mobile app
  • Limited technical support
  • Outsourced exam proctoring

The CE Shop

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A
Top Feature: Course is easy to follow, high pass rates among students

Why We Chose It: The CE Shop offers a variety of real estate education options with an interactive and inquiry-based approach in their studying methods. While their focus is mainly on continuing education, they also provide excellent pre-licensing courses, exam prep, and post-licensing education. Their courses are accredited by ARELLO and have received numerous awards for their educational programs.

Overview: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses can be taken in 34 states, through four different course packages: Courses Only, Standard Package, Value Package, and Premium Package. Every package comes with business ebooks, career resources, downloadable resources, real estate glossary, digital flashcards, study schedules, and access to instructor-led webinars. Students have praised the course content for being easy to follow and highly informative, which has led to high pass rates.

Why The CE Shop is Great for Pre-Licensing: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses emphasize real-world applications with scenario-based learning. This approach helps students apply their knowledge to practical situations they will face in their real estate careers. Additionally, The CE Shop provides an exam prep edge program that offers additional practice tests and study aids to ensure students are well-prepared for their licensing exams.

User Experiences and Feedback: The CE Shop is well-regarded for its robust customer support and comprehensive resources. The ability to access instructor-led webinars provides an additional layer of support and interaction, which can be particularly beneficial for students who need more guidance. The frequent promotions and discounts make it a cost-effective option for many. Students appreciate the clear and structured study schedules, which help them stay on track and complete the course efficiently.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $412
Basic Package Features: Texas Salesperson License Package: 180-hour instruction to qualify for the Texas Salesperson license, covering essential real estate principles and business knowledge. Includes six 30-hour courses: Principles of Real Estate I & II, Law of Agency, Law of Contracts, Promulgated Contracts and Forms, and Real Estate Finance.
Upgrade Packages: ProPath Real Estate Career Kickstarter: Includes the “Real Estate Basics and Beyond” eTextbook and three actionable courses: 30/60/90 Day Plan, Core Lead Network, and Negotiation Skills. Total of 9 hours of professional development to kickstart your real estate career, though it doesn’t count towards CE credits.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $101.25

Upgrade Packages: None

Post-Licensing

Price Starts at: $409
Basic Package Features: Texas SAE Post-Licensing Package: A 90-hour program fulfilling mandatory requirements for the first renewal cycle, excluding Texas Legal Update 1 & 2. Includes three 30-hour courses: Real Estate Appraisal, Real Estate Investment, and Real Estate Brokerage.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, The ProPath Real Estate Business Builder offers three key courses: Pricing Strategies for mastering home pricing, Tax Planning for managing finances and choosing retirement plans, and Budgeting to estimate earnings and plan for taxes. It’s designed to set you up for success in real estate.

Continuing Education

Basic Package Features: This 18-hour package meets Texas license renewal requirements with 11 mandatory and 7 elective hours. It includes courses on Texas Legal Updates I & II (4 hours each), Document Diligence (3 mandatory, 1 elective hour), Ethical Dilemmas (3 elective hours), and Investor Strategies (3 elective hours).
Upgrade Packages: Yes, This package includes the ProPath Real Estate Business Builder program, covering Pricing Strategies, Tax Planning, and Budgeting to ensure long-term success in your real estate career.

Pass Assurance: Exam cost reimbursed if you don’t pass on the first attempt.

  • Interactive and easy-to-follow course material
  • Frequent discounts and promotions

Cons:

Our Review Process:

At SmartAgentAlliance, our goal is to provide accurate and helpful reviews of online real estate schools to assist prospective real estate agents in making informed decisions. Our review process involves several key steps:

Research and Data Collection:

We begin by gathering comprehensive information about each real estate school, including course offerings, pricing, accreditation, and user reviews. This involves visiting the schools’ websites, reading third-party reviews, and gathering feedback from current and former students.

Evaluation Criteria:

Our evaluation is based on several important criteria, including:

  • Course Quality: We assess the content and structure of the courses to ensure they cover all necessary topics comprehensively and are easy to follow.
  • Accessibility: We evaluate the flexibility and accessibility of the courses, including the availability of mobile apps and study materials.
  • Pass Rates: We consider the pass rates of students who have completed the courses and taken the licensing exam.
  • Student Support: We look at the level of support provided to students, including access to instructors, customer service, and additional resources like study guides and practice exams.
  • Pricing: We compare the cost of the courses relative to the value they offer, including any discounts or payment plans available.
  • User Feedback: We gather and analyze feedback from students who have taken the courses to get an understanding of their experiences and satisfaction levels.

Scoring and Ranking:

Each school is scored based on the evaluation criteria, and an overall score is calculated. The scores are then used to rank the schools, with additional considerations given to standout features that may set a school apart from the rest.

AceableAgent, The CE Shop, Allied Real Estate Schools by Colibri, RealEstateU, and 360 Training.
